top_comments.comment: Hey guys,  Last Night of the Proms “Jerusalem”. Words William Blake/Milton n music Hubert Parry.  Check out the composition it’s beautiful. Back in the 80’s on the river in Cambridge, as the punt in front of us stopped under a bridge, a girl got up from the stern and sang Jerusalem. Phenomenal acoustics. It was a golden moment that still transports me to another world.

comments_since_last_sample.body:
Love this video!!
My top favorite underrated pieces are
1. Introduction and Allegro- Ravel
2.Symphonic Dances -Rachmaninoff (I played the piccolo part)
3. Poulenc Piano Sextet (Piano and Woodwind Quintet)
4. Reinecke Flute Concerto
5. The Engulfed Cathedral- Debussy
6. Piano Concerto- Samuel Barber (this concerto does not get enough love)
7. Symphony in C- Bizet (I’ve also played this one and I played first flute)
8. Gordeli Flute Concerto ( It’s basically the flutist’s Shostakovich concerto/Rhapsody in Blue)
9. Romanesque for Flute, Viola and Piano - Reynaldo Hahn
10. Sonata for Flute, Violin and Piano - Bohuslav Martinu (His Flute Sonata is gorgeous)
Honorable mentions
1. Rapsodia Negra for Piano and Orchestra -Ernesto Lecuona
2. El Amor Brujo-Manuel De Falla
3. Serenade Aux Etoiles -  Cecile Chaminade
You should hear: Evening in the mountain, 2 lyric pieces op.68 by Grieg
